name: Calculus I
description: This course introduces students to differential calculus. Students will learn about functions, limits, continuity, derivatives.

name: Calculus II
description: This course introduces students to integral calculus. Students will learn about antiderivatives, Riemann sums, fundamentals theorem of calculus.

name: Linear Algebra
description: This course introduces students to matrices, vectors, systems of linear equations, and linear transformations.

name: Probability and Statistics
description: This course introduces students to probability, descriptive statistics, probability distributions, statistical inference, and hypothesis testing.

name: Multivariable Calculus
description: This course introduces students to multivariable calculus. Students will learn about partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus.

name: Differential Equations
description: This course introduces students to differential equations. Students will learn about first-order differential equations, second-order differential equations, and Laplace transforms.

name: Numerical Methods
description: This course introduces students to numerical methods for solving mathematical problems. Students will learn about interpolation, approximation, and numerical integration and differentiation.

name: Real Analysis
description: This course introduces students to the rigorous study of real numbers and functions of a real variable.

name: Partial Differential Equations
description: This course introduces students to partial differential equations. Students will learn about the wave equation, diffusion equation, and Laplace's equation.

name: Topology
description: This course introduces students to topology, the branch of mathematics that deals with the properties of space that are preserved under continuous transformations.

name: Abstract Algebra
description: This course introduces students to abstract algebra, the study of algebraic structures such as groups, rings, and fields.
